metadata.title: CVE-2018-9275 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
In check_user_token in util.c in the Yubico PAM module (aka pam_yubico) 2.18 through 2.25, successful logins can leak file descriptors to the auth mapping file, which can lead to information disclosure (serial number of a device) and/or DoS (reaching the maximum number of file descriptors).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-9275` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-yubico - 2.26-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: yubico-pam package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26-1').
